results.title: [Phillip Annett Home Movie]
results.brief_description:
This home movie was originally created on 16mm film by Phillip Annett. It was donated to ACMI by Daryl Annett.

This film is a snap shot of suburban life in Melbourne. There are wonderful examples of fashion, inner-Melbourne street scenes, architecture and cars of the time. We see a children’s birthday party and backyard games under the Hills Hoist as well as neighbours chatting over the fence to passers-by in the street. Men in Australian Army and Air Force uniforms pose and smile for the camera, and there are scenes of a road trip to regional Victoria. We see a fire truck display, horse and harness riding as well as woodchopping displays at the Royal Melbourne Show. There are candid images of a horse event competitor in the stables area of the Royal Melbourne Show, as well as St Kilda Road buses and trams as they travel down the road. Black and white images of a horse and cart and a man in a bowler hat performing tricks is a fantastic moment in time.

Selected highlights list (timecodes from Access Overscan)

00:00:03:00 Close-up of men’s faces as they walk past the camera, waving their hats and gesturing. Great snapshot of the period and fashion.
00:00:07:00 Men walking towards camera showing great examples of 1940s fashion, streetscape and vintage cars
00:00:33:00 People in the street with Mynor Fruit Cup and The Sun advertising in the background
00:00:45:00 Two men in the street with Mynor Fruit Cup advertising in the background
00:00:46:00 Man in the street with vintage Myer delivery truck in background
00:00:47:00 Men with baby in vintage pram showing excellent examples of men’s fashion
00:00:56:00 Two men in RAAF Uniforms walk towards and past the camera
00:01:08:00 Man walks towards camera and waves with vintage cars beside him in the street
00:01:14:00 Two school boys holding hands walk down the street towards the camera
00:01:19:00 Young man riding towards camera on his bicycle, he waves. Good example of streetscape.
00:01:21:00 Man in the street smoking a pipe with vintage cars in the background
00:01:24:00 Small boy points and shoots a toy gun showing good example of children’s fashion
00:01:25:00 Two children run down the footpath. Good children’s fashion and street view.
00:01:28:00 Boy and girl stand on footpath and blow kisses
00:01:32:00 Sequence of images showing various individuals standing outside their houses. Good example of houses and street.
00:01:34:00 Old man wearing trousers and braces walking down the footpath
00:01:43:00 Exterior images of period houses
00:01:55:00 View of Government House from the interior of a car as they drive under a bridge
00:02:00:00 Lindberg and Foster signage
00:02:04:00 Sequence of images of women walking, towards and past the camera waving. Good fashion reference.
00:02:11:00 Woman with pram and baby walking down the street
00:02:13:00 Women walking down the street showing great fashion examples
00:02:49:00 Show pony/horse in backyard with show ribbons adorning its back. Impressed onlookers observe the prize winner of the 1949 Coast National Exhibition.
00:03:33:00 A man and a woman walk down a country road, a vintage car drives past in the background
00:03:43:00 Diggers Rest Post Office and General Store
00:03:45:00 People standing in rural setting country Victoria
00:04:36:00 Royal Melbourne Show fire truck display in main arena including Northwood Park fire truck with woodchopping in background
00:05:12:00 Royal Melbourne Show horse riding and woodchopping display
00:05:28:00 Harness racing display at Royal Melbourne Show
00:05:37:00 Horse riding and horse flag and barrel event Royal Melbourne Show
00:05:49:00 Girl on dapple grey horse riding in front of stables at the Royal Melbourne Show
00:05:59:00 Inner Melbourne street scenes, possibly Parkville
00:06:26:00 McInerney’s Hotel Max, Victoria Bitter, Orlando Wines signage on exterior brick wall. Great vintage car and period houses in front of sign.
00:06:29:00 Children in birthday party fashion attire
00:07:04:00 Children in party fashion outfits in suburban backyard with Hills Hoist, mums join in the fun
00:07:28:00 Men and women display great hair fashion of the day as they walk towards camera
00:07:37:00 Children at the birthday party stand under the Hills Hoist and watch a man riding a child’s three-wheel bike
00:07:41:00 Older man leads the birthday party children under the Hills Hoist. Good fashion reference for children.
00:07:55:00 Black and white horse and cart in front of Mynor Fruit Cup advertising. Man in bowler hat and braces runs back and forth and kicks his legs in the air. Great old footage from the time.
00:08:05:00 Women standing in front of sign for the Narbethong Blacks Spur Hotel
00:08:19:00 Man in uniform walks along the street outside pub/hotel
00:08:23:00 Two men talking in front of pub smiling and laughing. Good street and fashion scene in front of a pub/hotel.
00:08:30:00 Two women walk along the street pushing a woman in a wheel chair. They pass a Reckitts Blue advertising sign on a brick wall.
00:08:39:00 North Road City St Kilda Road bus
00:08:45:00 Melbourne number 7 945 tram to the city with signage “Ride in Comfort travel between 9.30 and 4.00”
00:09:01:00 Women exiting the pub/hotel onto the street. Good fashion reference.

results.title: The Teacher and the Computer
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Computers”.
Teacher, Anne McDougall, talks about the introduction of computers into education and the relationship of the teacher and the computer, a paper presented to the Junior World Computer Congress, Melbourne, October 16-18, 1980.

results.title: Mapping a city of fragments v.2
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description: Using the opening of Godard’s film ‘Alphaville’ as a foundation, Lord constructs a vision of the evolving global city during the last years of the 20th Century. Structured as a series of repetitions, the montage of the changing city is offset by shots of Silicon Valley corporate facades. The result is a dialectical contrast between urban and suburban space, body and mind, chaos and order, and the post-modern and the modern. Shot in Hi-8 video in Tokyo, Fukuoka City, Mexico City, Rome, San Francisco, Naples and Los Angeles.

results.title: Yolngu boy
results.creator_credit: Stephen Johnson, Gordon Glenn, Patricia Edgar, Burrundi Pictures and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Caught in a collision between the modern world of rap, football, and street cred and the oldest living culture on earth, Lorrpu, Botj and Milika are three Yolngu teenagers who once shared a childhood dream of becoming great hunters together. But things have changed and their paths are diverging. Botj is walking on the wild side, a lost soul in search of a place to belong. Milika is more interested in football and girls than any of the traditional knowledge he is being taught. Only Lorrpu seems to care about the dream any more. Their paths are diverging, and he is the only one who can see it.

When Botj goes too far and finds himself on the wrong side of both black and white laws, Lorrpu must weigh up his own future against saving his friend.

He persuades the boys to trek to Darwin to argue Botj’s case with Dawu, a tribal leader. Leaving behind their community, they journey through the unforgiving wilderness of north-east Arnhem Land to Darwin. To survive, Lorrpu, Milika and Botj must draw on the ancient bush knowledge they were taught as boys and, most importantly, the bonds of their friendship.

Yolngu Boy is about the search for identity, making the journey from adolescence to adulthood and the implications of belonging to a larger social group, whether it is a culture, a family or a group of friends.

results.title: [Charles Hayes Home Movies: Reel 10]
results.brief_description:
The Charles Hayes Home Movie Collection is a collection of home movies originally made on 8mm and 9.5mm film between the 1940s and 1970s by Charles Edward Hayes (1914–1993). The resulting footage shows us the life of a family living in Heathmont in Melbourne’s south east with their many pets and farm animals, their family holidays and gatherings, their suburb and their cars as well as scenes from Melbourne at the time.

This film shows rural Victoria footage around Omeo. It features excavation of, and images of, the Kiewa Hydro Electric scheme including power station interiors and exteriors and dam footage. Also included are hobby farm images, of children and adults with calves and chickens and pet dogs and cats. There is footage of a man collecting cow manure from paddocks.

We see images of the Royal Melbourne Agricultural Show Grand Parade with goats, horses, Ayrshire and Illawarra cattle, jinkers, floats, horse-drawn carts with advertising. There is also footage of children playing childhood games on the family farm – wheelbarrow races, chasey, ball games and piggy-backs.

Originally made using 9.5mm film.

Selected Highlights List (time codes from Access Overscan):

00:00:01:00 children feeding chickens on farm
00:00:11:00 child sitting on cow and falling off as cow stands
00:00:30:00 family and friends with farm animals
00:00:48:00 man working on farm with shovel collecting cow manure
00:00:59:00 two children with kitten fighting over who gets to hold it
00:01:15:00 children playing chasing, running games around trees in rural setting
00:01:26:00 children with grandmother playing with skipping rope in rural setting (good family images and fashion example)
00:01:35:00 family on ship with crew working in background
00:02:11:00 Maroondah Dam plaque with reservoir details
00:02:46:00 men and children playing piggy back, wheelbarrow races, ball games on rural property (ood footage of childhood games and playing)
00:03:15:00 child and woman on farm with calves (good rural footage and fashion example)
00:05:11:00 Royal Melbourne Agricultural Show Grand Parade including Ayrshire and Illawara cattle and goats
00:05:17:00 Royal Melbourne Agricultural Show Grand Parade with Jinkers, horses and carts, floats and advertising carts
00:08:19:00 Carnation Milk factory interior and exterior
00:08:57:00 Mount Beauty postal address plaque
00:10:01:00 rural footage of Kiewa Hydroelectric scheme, including images of interior and exterior power station, electricity poles and dam
00:10:33:00 road sign with vintage car in background: road sign indicating Upper Kiewa Valley Road; Mt Beauty; Rocky Valley; Howmans Gap

The resulting footage shows us the life of a family living in Heathmont in Melbourne’s south east with their many pets and farm animals, their family holidays and gatherings, their suburb and their cars as well as scenes from Melbourne at the time.

This film shows rural Victoria footage around Omeo. It features excavation of, and images of, the Kiewa Hydro Electric scheme including power station interiors and exteriors and dam footage. Also included are hobby farm images, of children and adults with calves and chickens and pet dogs and cats. There is footage of a man collecting cow manure from paddocks.

We see images of the Royal Melbourne Agricultural Show Grand Parade with goats, horses, Ayrshire and Illawarra cattle, jinkers, floats, horse-drawn carts with advertising. There is also footage of children playing childhood games on the family farm – wheelbarrow races, chasey, ball games and piggy-backs.

Originally made using 9.5mm film.

description_for_label:
The Charles Hayes Home Movie Collection is a collection of home movies originally made on 8mm and 9.5mm film between the 1940s and 1970s by Charles Edward Hayes (1914–1993). The resulting footage shows us the life of a family living in Heathmont in Melbourne’s south east with their many pets and farm animals, their family holidays and gatherings, their suburb and their cars as well as scenes from Melbourne at the time.

This film shows rural Victoria footage around Omeo. It features excavation of, and images of, the Kiewa Hydro Electric scheme including power station interiors and exteriors and dam footage. Also included are hobby farm images, of children and adults with calves and chickens and pet dogs and cats. There is footage of a man collecting cow manure from paddocks.

We see images of the Royal Melbourne Agricultural Show Grand Parade with goats, horses, Ayrshire and Illawarra cattle, jinkers, floats, horse-drawn carts with advertising. There is also footage of children playing childhood games on the family farm – wheelbarrow races, chasey, ball games and piggy-backs.

Originally made using 9.5mm film.

results.title: Patterns
results.brief_description: Patterns is a documentary which explores issues to do with politics, work, art and women’s history. A number of threads are woven between the sweatshop and the art gallery, the glory box and the political banner, bourgeois femininity and the question: should a feminist knit? An incisive and kaleidoscopic exploration of needlework and its place in women’s lives.

results.title: Drift
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and black and white, silent
results.brief_description: Since the first Apollo moon landing in the 1960s, NASA has compiled an enormous photographic record of its lunar saga. San Francisco photographer Michael Light gained access to the original negatives, presenting his collection of photography in major American and European museums including San Francisco Museum of Modern Art. As a reprise to his photographic exhibition ‘Full Moon’, Light has created ‘Drift’, an epic seven-minute loop of composite still imagery taken during NASA’s moon missions.
